mav_sim.chap11.dubins_parameters module¶

dubins_parameters

  • Dubins parameters that define path between two configurations

mavsim_matlab

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Update history:

    3/26/2019 - RWB 4/2/2020 - RWB 12/21 - GND

class mav_sim.chap11.dubins_parameters.DubinsParameters(p_s: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] = array([[9999.], [9999.], [9999.]]), chi_s: float = 9999, p_e: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] = array([[9999.], [9999.], [9999.]]), chi_e: float = 9999, R: float = 9999)¶

Bases: object

Class for storing the parameters for a Dubin’s path

mav_sim.chap11.dubins_parameters.compute_parameters(points: DubinsPoints) → DubinsParamsStruct¶
Calculate the dubins paths parameters. Returns the parameters defining the shortest

path between two oriented waypoints

Parameters:

points – Struct defining the oriented points and radius for the Dubins path

Returns:

variables for the shortest Dubins path

Return type:

dubin

mav_sim.chap11.dubins_parameters.mod(x: float) → float¶

Computes the modulus of x with respect to 2 pi

Parameters:

x – Angle

Returns:

Angle modified to be between 0 and 2pi

Return type:

x
